events.name: Keynote Special: Melonport
events.description:
Hi all, Ethereum Singapore is proud to present Melonport and their CTO, Reto Trinkler, in a keynote special for the month of April.¬† Melonport, a digital asset management protocol on the Ethereum blockchain, recently concluded their highly successful crowdsale, which saw them raise almost $3,000,000 (227,000 ETH). Read more here About the speakers:¬† 1) Gaurang Torvekar: Gaurang is the co-organizer of this Ethereum Singapore meetup and the co-founder of Attores, a blockchain solutions company that provides services such as document signing.¬† Attores.com 2) Reto Trinkler: Founder & CTO Reto is a blockchain developer with background in mathematics from ETH Zurich. He started developing Ethereum smart contracts immediately after their launch in 2015. He worked as a smart-contract developer at Brainbot Technologies (which is building the high-speed Raiden Network) and is host of Zurich's Blockchain Hacklab. Before this Reto developed a profitable trading algorithm for sport betting exchanges in C++. Discussion outline: - Introduction of Melonport - The Melon Vision - Innovative Business Ecosystem - How does it work?¬† - Demo of the application  


Melonport.com Event timeline: 6:30 - 7:00 pm : Registration 7:00 - 7:30 pm : Speaker 1 (Gaurang) 7:30 - 8:30 pm : Speaker 2 (Reto) 8:30 pm : End Event Organizers:¬†   


Venue Sponsor:¬†  Regards, Ethereum Singapore

events.name: Xamarin April Meetup: Async Programming / Azure Notification Hub
events.description: On our April session, we will share our Xamarin expertise on: ‚Ä¢ Xamarin Async Programming: Deep Dive (Ben Ishiyama-Levy) ‚Ä¢ Simplified Notifications using Notification Hub with Xamarin (Sohel Shekha) Nibbles and Networking from 6:30 Sessions starts at 7pm
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Michael Chen & Lim Shiyun from Zendesk
events.description: This April, we'll be chatting with Michael Chen¬†& Lim Shiyun, from Zendesk! And obviously we use the word chat because they have been the pioneers behind letting businesses chat with their customers right from their own website.  About Michael & Shiyun Mike and Shiyun are designers in Zendesk working on the Chat and Message products. They're part of an international team of designers, engineers and product managers who make kickass customer support tools.¬† Mike was previously a co-founder at Minitheory and an early stage employee at a fintech startup called inDinero. Shiyun focuses on thinking for the enterprise, and is currently a part-time design lecturer at Nanyang Technological University.¬† Agenda for the night¬† 7pm ‚Äì 7.30pm: Registration, drinks, snacks and networking¬†7.30pm ‚Äì 8.30pm: Conversation with Mike & Shiyun ¬†8.30pm ‚Äì 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at¬†kiat@ixda.sg¬†and I'll ask them on your behalf :)¬†Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to¬†@IxDASG¬†and we can have that answered! Special thanks to Zendesk for sponsoring the venue and snacks!¬† P.S: Zendesk is currently hiring a Product Designer!
events.location: Zendesk Singapore, 401 Commonwealth Drive Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01

events.name: TechLadies Study CS50 - Week 0 to 4 AGAIN
events.description:
Join us in this women-only study group to learn computer science! While there will be one or two mentors to answer any technical questions you have, you need to be self-reliant as much as possible as this is not a workshop. 

In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. As long as you are taking this course, please join us even if you're just getting started! üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please:

1. Create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

2. Start from Week 0 or continue where you've left off. As the free wifi we are tapping on at the cafes might sometimes not be that great, do watch the lecture videos before you come. 

Bring your fully charged laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out! We're trying out different cafes in search for the most ideal place (spacious, good wifi, convenient location). Until the search is over, do be prepared to tether from your phone when we meet.

Psst! This study group is for women only. :)
events.location: The Daily Roundup, 1 Keong Saik Road #01-02, Singapore 089109

events.name: Continuous Deployment Drupal Hosting with Platform.sh
events.description: Hey Drupalers, we rolling out another Drupal meetup for this month. This time we're going to talk about DevOps stuff which is Continues Deployment with Platform.sh Platform.sh is a powerful, scalable, developer-friendly hosting solution built from the ground up for stress-free Drupal hosting. Extending the core concepts of Git to the hosting infrastructure, Platform.sh gives you unrivalled continuous delivery workflows and faster time to market. Join Christopher Skene from Platform.sh for an in-depth demo of Platform.sh‚Äôs capabilities, including Q&A. About the Speaker:Christopher SkeneChris is a Regional Sales Manager (Asia-Pacific) for Platform.sh He across web development, marketing, information management and the semantic web, helping organisations optimise their knowledge assets for public consumption in networked world, and align their information strategies with their business model. His experience includes the government, education, not-for-profit, and media/publishing sectors. Note:We also gonna have some Pizza and drinks provided by PayPal, our venue sponsor :)
events.location: PayPal Singapore, 5 Temasek Boulevard, Suntec Tower 5, Level 7, #07-01
